page.title: 01The Chelmsley Wood Area
page.content: The dominant feature of the area is the overspill estate of Chelmsley Wood which was built in the 1970's to accomodate people from the inner city areas of Birmingham. The estate was built to high density specifications but with a variety of housing styles and with both private and council accomodation. The estate is self sufficient as far as services are concerned and has a large shopping centre although there is little provision for industry. To the south of the area is the smaller settlement of Marston Green, once a small village but now swallowed up as part of the sub-urban area of Birmingham. To the north and s.east much of the land is still farmland; predominantly mixed. This land is under pressure for development.This is in part due to its proximity to the M6 & M42 motorways.
